Democratic leaders, Bush set to meet after Iraq veto





President Bush's veto of a war-spending bill calling for the withdrawal of
most U.S. troops sparked a new round of finger-pointing and renewed talks
aimed at forging a compromise.





FULL STORY

Thousands of immigration marchers rally across U.S.





Demonstrators descended on city centers across the country Tuesday to press
Congress to give the estimated 12 million people in the United States
illegally a path to citizenship.

High fire risk seen for West, Southeast





The West and Southeast face an increased wildfire risk this year because of
ongoing drought and an expected hotter than average summer, the National
Interagency Fire Center reported Tuesday.

Report: Command to open fire heard on Kent State tape





A static-filled recording of war protesters yelling, followed by a voice and
gunfire, was released Tuesday by a survivor of the Kent State University
shooting who claims the tape proves a military order was given to fire on
demonstrators.





FULL STORY
















Father, relative charged in 10-year-old's scalding death





A 10-year-old disabled girl severely burned by scalding bath water died after
going more than a week without medical treatment, authorities said Tuesday.
Her father and a female relative were charged in her death.





FULL STORY
















FDA: Contaminated feed could affect farms nationwide





More farms across the United States will likely be affected by animal feed
tainted with recalled pet food, federal health officials said Tuesday, after
an investigation of Indiana chicken farms found the contaminated feed in more
than three dozen facilities that raise poultry for human consumption.





FULL STORY
















Trapeze artist plunges to his death during show





The fatal plunge of a Mexican circus trapeze artist during a show packed with
children is under investigation by the state's workplace safety division,
officials said Tuesday.





FULL STORY

Shadowy Iraq office accused of sectarian agenda





Iraq's prime minister has created an entity within his government that U.S.
and Iraqi military officials say is being used as a smokescreen to hide an
extreme Shiite agenda that is worsening the country's sectarian divide.





FULL STORY
      WATCH VIDEO
















Turkey faces possible early polls





Turkey turned its attention to the prospect of early elections on Wednesday
after Prime Minister Recep Tayyip Erdogan said he would seek national polls
within two months to end a stand-off with the country's secular elite.





FULL STORY
      WATCH VIDEO
















British sailors detained by Iran are back in Persian Gulf





Seven of the 15 British Royal Navy personnel held captive by Iran are back in
the Persian Gulf searching for smugglers, Britain's military said Tuesday.





FULL STORY
      WATCH VIDEO
















Turkish presidential vote annulled





Turkey's highest court halted a parliamentary vote Tuesday that looked certain
to install an Islamist president.

BUSINESS
 CNNmoney.com 








Murdoch's bold bid for the Journal





News Corp. has made an unsolicited $5 billion bid to buy Dow Jones & Co. - an
offer that could prove tough for the Bancroft family that controls the
publisher of The Wall Street Journal to turn down, industry analysts said
Tuesday.





FULL STORY
















Dow hits record again





The Dow industrials surged to an all-time high Thursday, ending at a new
record for the fourth time in the last five sessions as stocks found some
momentum at the end of a choppy day on Wall Street.

Rangers beat Sabres 2-1 again, tie series





NEW YORK (AP) -- This no-goal got the New York Rangers even with the Buffalo
Sabres in more ways than one.





FULL STORY
















Peter King: Catch of a Lifetime?





"I've got to be the Godfather today," Lions president Matt Millen said last
Saturday morning, sitting in the living room of his town house in the Detroit
suburb of Dearborn. He sounded full of hope and anticipation. In an hour
Millen, a man who badly needed a good day, expected to be fielding calls from
three or four clubs and hoped -- in a role reversal for Don Corleone -- that
someone would make him an offer he couldn't refuse in exchange for the No. 2
pick in the NFL draft.

What your child's doctor wishes you knew 





At the end of every appointment with a patient, I usually feel one of two
ways: "Wow! We really accomplished a lot in 15 minutes." Or: "Wow. Where did
it all go wrong?"

Heart attack death rate in hospitals cut in half in 6 years





In just six years, death rates and heart failure in hospitalized heart attack
patients have fallen sharply, most likely because of better treatment, the
largest international study of its kind suggests.

search the Web, moving beyond the one-size-fits-all approach to search it
already offers.

Would-be sleepers take on summer blockbusters





Sequels to "Shrek," "Spider-Man" and "Pirates of the Caribbean" aren't the
only movies coming out this summer. It only seems that way. Beneath the
Hollywood's behemoth franchise flicks, a few less-heralded gems sneak in to
become niche hits and sometimes $100 million smashes.





FULL STORY
















Tom Poston, TV's clueless everyman, dead at 85





Tom Poston, the tall, pasty-faced comic who found fame and fortune playing a
clueless everyman on such hit television shows as "Newhart" and "Mork and
Mindy," has died. He was 85.
